Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... Can't speak because of the commandments.

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that you can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Man... So we really can't talk because of the Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of the commandments, you aren't allowed to talk to women....

Entry.JapaneseText: 売りたそうにしているが、 戒律のせいで、異性とは 話ができないようだ。
Entry.EnglishText: He looks like he wants to sell, but because of the commandments, he can't seem to talk to the opposite sex.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「潮は引き、潮は満ちる…… 人の心が波に流されても 私は流される事はない……」
Entry.EnglishText: "The tide ebbs and the tide rises... When a person's heart is swept away. by the waves, I will not be swayed"

Entry.JapaneseText: 「私は波間をさすらう小船。 流されているのではない。 ただ……浮かんでいるだけ……」
Entry.EnglishText: "I am but a small boat wandering through the waves. I'm not being swept away. Just floating in the sea..."

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は詩人…… つれづれなるままに、 想いを詩にする心の旅人……
Entry.EnglishText: I am... a poet. I am a traveler of the heart who writes poems about my thoughts as I go along.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「憎しみは愛の背中…… 愛は憎しみの花……」
Entry.EnglishText: "Hate and love share the same fate... As love is that which blooms hate..."

Entry.JapaneseText: 「失恋は種を落とし、 恋の芽が大地に息吹く……」
Entry.EnglishText: "Heartbreak begets seeds, from which the bud of love starts to breathe..."

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は詩人…… 哀しき恋を詩にする、 さすらいのフラレ虫……
Entry.EnglishText: I am... a poet. I am a wandering flounder who writes poems about the sadness of love.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「ひとつの終わりは ひと抱えの始まりを」
「ひとつの悲しみは ひと抱えの喜びをもたらす。 空は笑って見ている……」
Entry.EnglishText: "Each sorrow brings a joy. The sky smiles down upon me..."

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は詩人…… 地鳴りが耳をふさごうと、 私は歌い続けるだけ……
Entry.EnglishText: I am... a poet. Even though the earth rumbles in my ears, I just keep on singing...

Entry.JapaneseText: 「ひとつの終わりは ひと抱えの始まりを」
「ひとつの悲しみは ひと抱えの喜びをもたらす。 空は笑って見ている……」
Entry.EnglishText: "Each sorrow brings a joy. The sky smiles down upon me..."

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は詩人…… <Mao>とかいう歌好きに負けず、 歌い続けるだけ……
Entry.EnglishText: I am... a poet. As long as songlovers like <Mao> continue to sing along...

Entry.JapaneseText: 「我が愛よ、君に届け。 我が心よ、君を救え。 我が祈り、君を守れ。」
Entry.EnglishText: " My love, send it to you. My heart, to save you. My prayer, protect you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「我は愛されずとも…… 我は愛し続ける…… それが愛の極意と見つけたり……」
Entry.EnglishText: " I may not be loved... Yet I continue to love... That's how I found... the secret of love."

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は詩人…… フラレ続け知った真の愛。 愛の光が今、世界に満ちている……
Entry.EnglishText: I am... a poet. The true love that I have endured through countless rejection. The light of love now fills the world...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は詩人…… 詩だけが私の心を いやしてくれる……
Entry.EnglishText: I am... a poet. Only poetry can heal this heart of mine...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは山の上に住んでいたんだが、 ヒューマに追い出されたんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I used to live on top of the mountains, but the Huma forced me out....

Entry.JapaneseText: 貴様ら…… ヒューマのせいで……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Those foul people... If it wasn't for the Huma...!!

Entry.JapaneseText: 結局、ヒューマの連中は 単に祭司の座をガジュマに 渡したくないだけなんだよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: After all, the Huma simply does not want to hand over the position of priest to Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: バイラスが大量発生している。 充分注意するんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: There's a large number of Veiras outbreaks. Be very careful!

Entry.JapaneseText: この国に生きる<Yellow>ヒト<White>を守る。 それが我らの使命だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Protecting the <Yellow>People<White> living in this country. That is our mission.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私の事なら心配はいらないわ。 クレアさんや他の娘たちを 助ける事だけ考えなさい。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have to worry about me. Just focus on helping Claire and the other girls.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私の事なら心配しないで。 今のあなたには、もっと 大切な事があるんだもの。
Entry.EnglishText: If it's about me, don't worry. There are more important things for you to do right now.

Entry.JapaneseText: 仲間のために戦うっていう 大切な使命がね。
Entry.EnglishText: Fighting alongside your friends, for example.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、がんばるさ！ 姉貴も気をつけてな。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, I'll do my best! Take care of yourself, sis.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私たちみんな、 クレアに励まされました。
Entry.EnglishText: We were all encouraged by Claire to keep going.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしクレアと会えたら、 また会いたい…… そう言っていたと伝えてください。
Entry.EnglishText: If you see Claire, I'd like to see her again... Please tell her that if you could.

Entry.JapaneseText: あまり頼りにならない 弟かもしれませんが……
Entry.EnglishText: He may not be a very dependable brother, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 少しでも皆さんの力になれれば…… よろしくお願いします。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope he can help you all in some small way... Thank you for fighting alongside him.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたが必ず 助けに来てくれる…… クレアさんはそう信じていました。
Entry.EnglishText: You'd always come to our rescue.... Claire never stopped believing that.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたが<Veigue>さん…… クレアが話してました。
Entry.EnglishText: So you're <Veigue>... Claire told me about you.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたが絶対助けに 来てくれるって……
Entry.EnglishText: She said you'd definitely come save us....

Entry.JapaneseText: 助けられた今でも 一体、何があったのか さっぱりわかりませんが……
Entry.EnglishText: Even though everyone here is safe, I have no idea what'll happen or what to do next....

Entry.JapaneseText: でもそんな事は どうでもいいんです。 本当に、ありがとうございました。
Entry.EnglishText: But what matters is that you came. Really, thank you from the bottom of my heart.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当に、皆さん、 ありがとうございます。
本当は男の方にも直接お礼を 言いたいのですが……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd really like to thank the men in person directly but...

Entry.JapaneseText: こういう時、戒律って 少しもどかしいですね。
Entry.EnglishText: At times like this, the commandments are a bit frustrating to work with.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうやら、彼女も この街の娘のようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: Looks like she's a girl from this city then...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律だネ。 この街の人だったみたい……
Entry.EnglishText: That's the commandments alright. So she's from the city...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか…… 彼女もこの街の娘か……
Entry.EnglishText: I see... A girl from Babilograd.
Oh right, the commandments are still in effect.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00009d>どこから来やがった！ リフトは閉鎖中のはずだぞ!?
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00009D>How the hell did you get here?! The lift should have been suspended!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00009e>その人たちは返してもらうヨ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00009E>We've come to take those girls back!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c00009f>レディたちの前で 騒ぎは困りますな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C00009F>Do refrain from causing a ruckus in front of the ladies.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a1>手を尽くしたつもりでしたが…… 隊長がこれほど早くこの街に お見えになるとは……計算外でした。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A1>I had everything planned out so thoroughly, but...for the Commander to arrive here with such haste was certainly...unexpected.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a2>もう少し着くのが遅かったら、 おまえがここで動き回っていた事すら わからなくなっていただろうな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A2>Had we shown up just a bit later, we probably wouldn't have even known you were up to anything in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a3>しかし、私は私の仕事を 完遂させていただきますよ、隊長。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A3>However, I will see to it that my mission is completed, Commander.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a4>俺は争いを望んでいるわけではない。 手を引け、ワルトゥ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A4>I'm not looking for a fight. Stand down, Walto!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a5>我らの任務は、彼女たちを 女王陛下のもとへ無事に送り届ける事。 任務の放棄は、王国への反逆を意味します。 私が王国を裏切るとお思いですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A5>Our mission is to safely deliver these girls into the hands of Her Majesty the Queen. Abandoning that mission would be the same as treason. Do you take me for a traitor?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a6>こんな事をして何になる、ワルトゥ！ これが国のためになるというのか!?
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A6>What could you possibly hope to gain from this, Walto? How is this supposed to benefit our kingdom?!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a7>私もこのようなやり方を 望んでなどいません。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A7>This is not the way I would have chosen to do things, either.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a8>しかし、事は急を要するとの ご下命を賜った以上、些細な事に 気を配っている余裕はないのです。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A8>However, I do not have the luxury to be concerned with trivialities when tasked with such an urgent mission.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000a9>だったら、こっちも 力ずくで奪い返すだけだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000A9>Then we'll do whatever we have to in order to get those girls back!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ab>姉貴、大丈夫か！ さあ、こっちへ来るんだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000AB>Sis, are you okay? Come on, get away from them!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ad>貴様ら、姉貴に ナニしやがった!?
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000AD>The hell did you bastards do to my sister?!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ae>お願いをしただけですよ。 しばらく動かないでほしい、と。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000AE>I merely gave her a request. I asked her not to move for a little while.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000b0>急を要するとの命を受けたとはいえ、 手荒な真似は出来る限り避けたいのです。 皆さんもお引取り願えますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000B0>Although my mission is of grave importance, I would nonetheless prefer to avoid bloodshed. Would you mind leaving us be?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000b2>それとも…… 我らを倒して彼女たちを助けますか？ もっとも、ここで戦えば彼女たちは無事では 済みますまい……動けないのですからね。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000B2>So then... You want to try defeating us and rescuing these girls? There is no certainty that they would walk away from a battle here unharmed... They are immobile, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000b4>……おまえらしからぬ やり方だな。
<voice:1c0000b5>私は任務遂行のためなら 手段を選ばない。 これは遊びではないのですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000B5>If I am to fulfill this mission, I cannot limit my options. You'd do well to keep in mind that this is not a game.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000b8>こんな奴らの言いなりになってはダメよ。 あなたたちが命を賭けて戦うのなら、 私も命を賭けるわ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000B8>You can't let him subdue you just like that! If all of you are putting your lives on the line, then I will do the same!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ba>戦ってください！ お願いします！
<voice:1c0000bc>このままでは、どのみち 彼女たちを救う事はできない。 ……やるぞ！ <Tytree>!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000BC>Fighting is our only hope of saving them, given our current situation. Let's do it, <Tytree>!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000bd>穏便に話をつけたかったのですが、 そうもいかないようですね。 ……いいでしょう。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000BD>I tried to settle this peacefully, but it appears that was in vain. ...Very well.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000be>ただ、本当に彼女たちを 傷つけてしまっては、 私の立つ瀬がありません。 ミリッツァ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000BE>However, it would be quite a problem for me if any harm truly befalls these girls. Militsa.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000c8>ミリッツァ……どうして…… こんな事したって、 純粋な<Yellow>ヒト<White>の身体なんて 手に入らないのよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000C8>Militsa...why? You must realise that you can't obtain a "<Yellow>pure body<White>" by doing things like this!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000c9>言ったはずだ…… <Blue>王の盾<White>以外に 私の居場所はないと……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000C9>I told you before... I have nowhere to go besides the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ca>それともおまえは…… ハーフの居場所を見つけた とでもいうのか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000CA>Or do you mean to tell me...that you've found a place where we Halfbloods can be fully accepted?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000cd>お見事でした、隊長…… しかし、任務は必ず遂行します。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000CD>That was truly magnificent, Commander... However, my resolve has not weakened.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000cf>しばらく…… 意識を失って頂きますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000CF>For the time being... Do me a favor and stay down.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000d3>ずいぶんと騒がしいではないか。 ワルトゥよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000D3>This is quite the commotion, Walto, is it not?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000d6>カレギア王国軍の将軍、 ミルハウスト・セルカークだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000D6>He's the General of the Callegean Army, Milhaust Selkirk.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000d7>軍に入隊してすぐに頭角を現し、 その手腕と人望を買われて、 若くして将軍になった、 エリート中のエリートさ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000D7>He made a name for himself soon after joining the army. Despite his young age, he advanced to general in no time thanks to his skill and popularity. An elite among the elite.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000d8>バビログラードの動向が 慌しいと聞きおもむいてみれば、 民間人を巻き込んでのこの騒ぎ。 何をしている？ 説明しろ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000D8>Regardless of your reasons for coming all the way to Babilograd, you have caused a turbulence and even gotten civilians involved. What is this meaning of this? Explain yourself.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000d9>恐れながら、我ら<Blue>王の盾<White>の 任務はアガーテ様の勅命。 陛下の許可なくして 私が語る事はありません。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000D9>With all due respect, the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>'s mission was a direct request of Queen Agarte. I cannot divulge any information without Her Majesty's consent.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000da>……そうだったな。 ならば、陛下に直接 うかがうまでの事。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000DA>...Is that so. I will discuss the matter with Her Majesty directly.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000db>だが、ここは退け。 私の目の前で民を傷つける事は許さん。 私が忠誠を誓ったカレギアはすなわち、 カレギアの民そのものでもある。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000DB>However, I want you to withdraw from here. I won't allow civilians to be harmed before my very eyes. I swore an oath of loyalty to Callegea, and that means I am honor-bound to protect its citizens.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000dd>どうしてもと言うのならば、 私が相手になろう。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000DD>If you continue to press the matter, then I shall be your next opponent.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000de>そこまで申されるならば…… 承知いたしました。 隊長、後ほどお会いしましょう。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000DE>If it means avoiding needless confrontation... Then I will go no further. Until next time, Commander.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000e1>久しぶりだな、ミルハウスト……
<voice:1c0000e2>……以前は国のために 尽力し合った仲とはいえ、 あなたは国と袂を分かった。 語る事など……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000E2>We may have fought side by side once as brothers in arms, but you have turned your back on our kingdom. I have nothing to discuss with you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000e3>そうか…… だが、かつての同志として ひとつだけ忠告する。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000E3>...I see. However, as one you once called an ally, I'm going to give you one piece of advice.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000e5>一刻も早く、女王陛下のもとへ行け。 そして、何が起こっているのか、 おまえの目で確かめて欲しい。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000E5>Return to the Queen's side as soon as possible. Once you're there, I want you to analyze the situation yourself.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000e6>おまえには真実が見えるはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000E6>You should be able to figure out the truth.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000e7>互いの刃を交える日が 来ない事を、俺は切に願う。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000E7>...I hope the day we cross our blades never comes. I mean it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000e9>待って……！ ミルハウストさんよ!!
<voice:1c0000ea>みんなを助けてくれて、 ありがとうよ!!
<voice:1c0000ed>姉貴、この人たちはみんな、 ヤツらにさらわれて来たんだよな？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000ED>Hey sis, were all of you captured by those guys?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ee>そうよ。 それで山の上の聖殿に閉じ込められていたの。 私たち以外にも、大勢の女の子たちがいたわ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000EE>That's right. They took us to a shrine on top of the mountain and locked us in. We weren't the only girls in there either.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ef>なあ、その中に<Claire>って 名前の娘はいなかったかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000EF>Was there a girl named <Claire> with you guys by any chance?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000f2>でも、どうしてあなたが その名前を？
<voice:1c0000f3>こいつの…… <Veigue>の恋…… もとい、友達なんだ。
<voice:1c0000f4>そう……でも、<Claire>さんは 他の娘たちと一緒に 連れていかれたわ……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000F4>I see... But <Claire> was taken away from here with the rest of the girls.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000f5><Claire>はいつ、ここから 連れていかれたんですか!?
<voice:1c0000f8>奴らはなぜあなたたちを さらったのか、何か話を していませんでしたか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000F8>Why were you kidnapped? They didn't tell you anything?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000f9>いいえ、何も…… ただ、ひとつだけ 気になる事が……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000F9>No, nothing. Although, there was one thing that bothered me...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000fb>聖殿にいる時に、 外から聞こえて来たんです。 「もう時間がない。月が満ちる」……って。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000FB>When we were at the shrine, I heard a voice coming from outside. They said "We're running out of time. The full moon is almost upon us.”

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000fc>月が満ちる……満月の日に 何かが起こるというの？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000FC>The full moon? ...Is something going to happen on the day of the full moon?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000fd>ごめんなさい、 そこまでは……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000FD>Sorry, but beyond that I don't know a thing...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000fe>確か、次の満月は <Blue>ゴルドバの日<White>の夜ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C0000FE>If I'm not mistaken, the next full moon is on <Blue>Goldova's Day<White>, isn't it?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c0000ff><Blue>ゴルドバの日<White>には お披露目の儀式があるんだヨ！
<voice:1c000100>やはり、一連の<Blue>王の盾<White>の行動と 儀式には関連があるようだな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000100>Then it looks like there really is a connection between the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>'s scheming and the ceremony.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000103>姉貴、悪いけど…… おれは一緒には帰れない。 他の娘たちを助けるまでは 手放しで喜ぶ気にはなれないんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000103>Sorry sis, but... I can't go home with you. I wouldn't be able to rest easy knowing that the other girls are still in trouble.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000104>ええ。わかってるわ。 一緒に帰るなんて言ったら、 私に怒られるトコだったわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000104>Yeah, I know. I'd have gotten mad if you said you wanted to go back with me!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1c000106>気をつけるのよ。 みなさんも、お気をつけて。 <Tytree>をよろしくお願いします。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1C000106>Be careful. And that goes for everyone. Please take care of <Tytree> for me!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00><scale:0140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00><scale:0140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
